node.name: intalling prograns and depencies
node.rich_text:
dependencies are other files that work together with a given to run or the program is dependent on these to run smoothly
>sudo apt-get install program_name (this works for only known programs
>sudo apt-cache search program_name (searches for any program if you dont know its name)
>sudo apt-get update (updates all the repositories within the system)
>sudo apt-get upgrade (updates all programs to their latest versions)
>sudo nano etc/apt/sources.list (you can customize the repositories from this file) - in this file, you can add any new repos you would want to fetch your programs and dependencies but incase you want them only
- in this file, you can uncomment the extras.ubuntu.com trusty main line for you to access extra depencies
- after run the update command ->sudo apt update
- checking for new ubunut releases, but will return nothing if your system is already update - If you installed an LTS version, you will have some 7 years of support, with latest drives with updated security features for all that time
- >sudo do-release-upgrade
- uninstalling softwares - >sudo apt-get remove program/software_name
